title: LARAVEL
summary: A powerful PHP framework for building modern web applications. I’ve mastered it through real-world experience, creating two live commercial products using this technology.

title: PHP
summary: A versatile server-side scripting language used for web development. I have solid experience with it, from debugging in live projects to building personal projects.

title: HTML & CSS
summary: The foundational languages for structuring and styling web pages. I have strong proficiency, using them extensively to create visually appealing websites and user interfaces.

title: Javascript
summary: A dynamic scripting language for enhancing web interactivity. I have a moderate level of proficiency, focusing on tasks like dynamic data loading and interactive features.

title: Bootstrap & Tailwind
summary: Bootstrap has been my go-to for rapid, responsive design, enhancing UI efficiently. Explore Tailwind recently for greater flexibility and more customization in styling.

title: Python & Django
summary: Experienced in Python for DSA and now deepening the skill by enlisting in a Django bootcamp to build powerful web applications.

title: React & Node.js
summary: Always planned to add MERN Stack to my skill set. Once fully proficient in JavaScript, React and Node.js will be the next focus for full-stack development.

title: MySQL & Rest API
summary: Extensively used MySQL in various projects and experienced in implementing REST APIs in a commercial application for data exchange with separate database servers.

title: Machine Learning Libraries
summary: Gained some experience using ML libraries while developing models for academic projects and research. Eager to expand my knowledge as ML and AI represent the future.

title: Tensorflow
summary: A powerful and efficient framework for machine learning. I’ve used it to train multiple models during my research, finding it handy & very accessible libraries.

title: Kaggle
summary: A popular platform for data science competitions and model training. I’ve used it for training models and plan to join competitions as I advance in Machine Learning.

title: AWS & Docker
summary: AWS offers cloud computing services, while Docker is for containerization. Little experience from my past job, learned from zero and deploying apps on Windows EC2.
